sub_title: PhD Researcher on societal impacts of coral reef restoration in Shimoni, Kenya
summary: I am a PhD researcher focusing on the societal impacts of coral reef restoration in Shimoni, southern Kenya. This is inspired by the blue transition for sustainable marine future. Over the last two decades, I have passionately worked as tourism and nature conservation leader with experience in sustainable tourism development, responsible tourism, nature conservation, stakeholders' engagement, guest relations and experiences. Besides my research work, I have active roles at Wageningen University focusing on different topics and tasks related to the quality of education, WUR community wellbeing and social safety.

authors.headline: PhD Researcher on societal impacts of coral reef restoration in Shimoni, Kenya

profile_positions.description: My PhD research focus on societal aspects on the coral reef restoration in Shimoni, south coast of Kenya. This is guided by four themes on how reef restoration enhances coral reef ecosystem services, stakeholder's engagement, socioeconomic benefits, and alternative livelihoods as a way of reducing pressure to the marine environment.
profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate

profile_positions.description:
Promote all the MSc-programmes of the Wageningen University that are registered Croho and mentioned on the wur.eu-website, including the Online Master programmes. 
Provide relevant information to prospective candidates on application procedures for enrollment in the WU-MSC-programme.

DISCLAIMER: I DON'T have power to enroll students on behalf of the University or power to determine/influence the awarding of any scholarship to study at WUR. All prospective students MUST be qualified and are required to follow all procedures.
profile_positions.title: International Representative

profile_positions.description:
OSIRIS - developing a one-off student platform
The Sounding Board deliberated on thoughts and ideas facilitating development and designing process a better version of the Student Portal. The platform provided constructive critical attitude for offering requested and unsolicited advice or idea from the perspective of student and staff.
profile_positions.title: Student Portal - Sounding Board Member

profile_positions.description:
The Student Council represents the interest of over 12,000 students in Wageningen University. As one of the central participatory bodies of Wageningen University, the council has powers and rights of approval, advisory, initiative and information. Executive Board requires the Council to exercise her rights to assist in their process of every decision toward strategies and policies to guarantee quality of education.

More details: https://www.wur.nl/en/about-wur/management-organisation/student-council-1.htm
profile_positions.title: Student Council Member

profile_positions.description: MSc programme Tourism, Society and and Environment: Extensive study reasoning behind the transformation of certain locations into tourism environments with special attention to concepts such as landscape, space, place, locality, authenticity and sustainability.
profile_positions.title: MSc Leisure, Tourism and Environment

profile_positions.description: Blue Bees offers an alternative livelihood opportunity for local communities particularly women in the Shimoni region, south coast of Kenya through sustainable production of honey and wax. Inspired by ecotourism and sustainable social enterprises.
profile_positions.title: Founder

company.name: S&I : Student Council party Wageningen University

profile_positions.company: S&I : Student Council party Wageningen University
profile_positions.description:
Sustainability and Integration (S&I) is one of the Student Council Political Party at Wageningen University. Served as Party Chair in the academic year 2018 - 2019 with milestones:
- Implementation of the Free Dutch Language (Social A1 and A2) courses for all international students
- Promoting integration through international classroom dialogue
- Improving sustainability with reduction of single-use plastic (involved in bringing Billie Cup in partnership with Green Office and WUR Sustainability Office)
- Enhancing student well-being (involved initial stages of Surf Your Stress)
- Strengthened integration that earned the party 4th seat in the Student Council 2019-2020.
profile_positions.title: Chair

profile_positions.description: Hosted by Better Places Travel (https://www.betterplacestravel.com/) - a sustainable travel company in Leiden. During my internship, I helped with developing travel advises using Carmacal (flight carbon calculator) on how Better Places client can reduce their carbon emission during their travel to holiday destinations.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Intern

profile_positions.description:
Lead on guarantee visitor's experiences at the conservancy through conservation education and diverse hands-on conservation activities. Key responsibilities and milestones:
- Providing management and product development ideas for tourism department
- Communication with diverse visitors seeking nature-based experiences at the conservancy
- Developing hands-on and conservation education activities to enhance visitor's experiences including neighbouring schools and local communities
- Indoors and outdoors hosting of visitors group in different tourists site in the conservancy 
- Coordinate unique 'Conservation in Action' program - behind the scene of conservancy work
- Providing leadership to a team of 15 professional field guides and drivers
- Organizing capacity building trainings for conservancy and community guides to improve on essential guiding knowledge and skills
- Coordination conservation outreach/awareness program for the neighbouring schools and locals
- Fundraising for the conservation education program up to US$10,000 through partnership and grants.
profile_positions.title: Tourism Education Officer

profile_positions.description:
Planning, co-ordination and facilitation of Environmental education and outreach programme with key responsibilities as:
- Guided nature/botanical tours in the Arboretum
- Developing environmental education and outreach materials
- Managing social media outlet with interactive postings
- Coordinating periodic biodiversity monitoring activities
- Representation of FONA in various conservation forums
- Organizing and source guest speakers for FONA’s monthly lectures on various themes
- General management and operation of FONA office e.g. communication and membership recruitment
profile_positions.title: Arboretum Education Officer

profile_positions.description:
Providing tour consultancies with experiential tour packages in Kenya with key responsibilities:
- Providing advices safari packages in Kenya
- Preparing tour packages including itineraries and costing for different clientele
- Conducting tour as per itineraries including accommodation reservation in different facilities
- Transport arrangements arrival/departure transfers and during safaris
- Providing professional guiding services through nature interpretation.
profile_positions.title: Founder, Tour Consultant & Field guide

profile_positions.description:
Providing tour consultancy on birding tours in Kenya
- Providing relevant birding tour advises from birding inquiries
- Preparing and running birding itineraries
- Reservation of various accommodation options
- Providing guiding (birding) whenever necessary.
profile_positions.title: Birding Tour Consultant & Field Guide

profile_positions.description:
Providing assistance in planning of 2010 Fundamental of Ornithology (FoO) course
- Planning and coordination of the course
- Coordinating the reviewing of the course book including workshop for course facilitators.
- Actual planning and execution of the course at Elsamere Field Study Centre, Naivasha in April 2010.
- Compiling of the final course report highlighting success and areas of improvement.
profile_positions.title: Fundamental of Ornithology Fellow (Assistant)

volunteer_experiences.description: Representing international community by providing necessary advice(s) to the AID Wageningen Board on summer AID programme to enhance orientation and better experiences for the new students.
Host for cultural night to help new students discover and experiencing different cultures across the world.
In the midst of Covid pandemic, 2020 AID Newsflash team helped new students to about the programme on the daily events and what to expect.
Led a team of 6 enthusiastic volunteers in planning whole day logistics and setting up location for WUR Student Career Services - Career day 2019.
Photography coverage of the 38th Veluweloop event covering different sections and stages in the green trails of the Veluwe.
Enhancing sustainability practises by encouraging sustainable actions during AID, activities and groups. Launched Sustainable Award rewarding - Most Sustainable AID Gadget.
AID crews are backbone, taking a behind the scene role to assist in preparation and build-up in readiness for Annual Introduction Days.
Assisting with orientation of new students to Wageningen University during the summer Annual Introduction Days (AID) as easier way to adjust and adapt in new learning environment.
A role to promote cultural diversity and integration among the African students and other international students at Wageningen University, Netherlands.

Assisting in communication and organizing extra-curriculum activities (study/fun trips, career events and social-bonding potluck dinners/BBQs) for students under master's programme Tourism, Society and Environment, Wageningen University.
Team leader of volunteers at the 2013 Ecotourism and Sustainable Tourism Conference in Nairobi, Kenya

volunteer_experiences.role: Visitor Guide - Nairobi Safari Walk/Animal Orphanage
volunteer_experiences.description: Providing wildlife conservation education and acquiring critical guiding skills as a guide.
